invest.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit
invest.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
He had invested heavily (=invested a lot of money) in the bond market.
Oliver made a fortune by investing in antique furniture.
Williams invested a large sum of money in Swiss stocks.
invest.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if a government, business, or organization invests in something, they spend a large amount of money to improve it or help it succeed
invest.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The city has invested millions of dollars in the museum.
The factory plans to invest in new computers.
invest.translation[0].definitions[1].not: In everyday English, people often say put money in/into something rather than invest in something:
He put money into his brother’s business.
The government put in millions of pounds.
invest.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to use a lot of time, effort etc or spend money in order to make something succeed
invest.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
invest.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: to buy shares or property, in order to make a profit
Why don’t you invest the money on the stock market?
He invested £50,000 in his brother’s business.
Investing in property is probably not a good idea right now.
to give money to a business, organization, activity etc, in order to help it develop and be successful
We’re looking for an investor who will put money into our business.
Every year the charity puts millions of dollars into research to find ways to treat cancer.
to invest in a project or business, especially when the fact that you do this shows you support it
The scheme has been backed by several major companies.
The movie is backed by a powerful state-owned bank.
if you have an interest in a particular company, you own shares in it
In 1986 GM acquired a controlling interest (=enough shares to control what decisions are taken) in the sports car maker Lotus.
He has business interests throughout Europe.
invest.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to buy shares, bonds, property etc in order to make a profit
invest.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: People are so pessimistic about the future that they won’t invest at the moment.
The Singapore government is interested in investing abroad.
The fund hadinvested heavily in risky assets like junk bonds.
invest.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to save money in a high interest bank account or to buy an insurance policy that pays BONUSES
invest.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Before investing, investors should ask about the financial soundness of the company that issues the annuity.
invest.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to spend money on things that will make a business more successful and profitable
invest.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: It is investing some $60 million to maintain its edge in technology.
The company has been investing hundreds of millions of dollars in new production facilities.
